column5: Pruning back old leaves is a really good way to encourage new growth on a croton.

Concave leaves usually indicate the aloe is thirsty. If they aren‚Äôt plumping back up when you water it and it‚Äôs very root-bound, you may need a bigger pot. My aloe was doing the same thing and I realized there was compacted soil around the roots so they weren‚Äôt getting water. I brushed them off, repotted him, gave him a good bottom watering, and he‚Äôs doing much better now.
You‚Äôre welcome, I hope it helps!

Definitely needs more light. Remove the dead and dying leaves‚Äîonce he‚Äôs healthier there will be new growth there! Crotons also really don‚Äôt like being moved and take a while to perk up after you move them. Once he‚Äôs in a sunnier spot he likes more and gets used to it, you could also give him some fertilizer.
Have you fertilized it? I had a snake plant basically not grow at all for 4 or 5 months, then I used a basic fertilizer and in a month those little baby leaves have really shot up!

Ohh okay, I thought you meant all plants for some reason. The shoot isn‚Äôt buried in the soil, the soil level is lower down in the pot so the leaves just reach over the top of the pot. Thanks for the food for thought, I‚Äôll definitely look into it!

Oh noooo I thought I was so smart repotting my Dracaena lower down in a pot after he lost some bottom leaves. He‚Äôs flourishing for now but I should give him a boost one of these days.
Totally depends on the seller and their policies. I hope you get a refund or new plant!
Your Birkin is gorgeous!!
I rescued my office plants on the last day I was allowed in the building back in March. Both have flourished in my apartment!
Snake plants are super easy, don‚Äôt need a ton of light, and the leaves are fairly thick and rigid‚Äîthat makes it harder for cats to munch on them.

Having a cat is awesome! How much of a problem this would be for you depends mostly on the cat. My cat doesn‚Äôt usually bother with my houseplants, but I do try to keep them out of his reach because he has a tendency to knock plants over when he‚Äôs playing or checking out birds. I like to put plants on shelves and fill up windowsills/end tables with pots entirely so my cat can‚Äôt jump up and mess with them. Hanging baskets would be ideal unless the vines trail long enough to be within the cat‚Äôs reach‚Äîa trailing vine sounds like an awesome cat toy.
Nice haul and happy birthday! Is that a trailing jade in the middle?
I‚Äôve been wanting to get a plant from there. They sell out pretty quickly!
What a cutie! They don‚Äôt mind being root bound and she‚Äôs still pretty small, I think you should wait a bit.

Careful with the radiator!! Sitting to close to one was what finally did in my years-old pothos.

I can relate :( at my most depressed I took perverse joy in watching a spider plant my mom propagated for me die (sorry to get kinda dark), but that feels like another lifetime now. 

Reach out to friends or neighbors to rehome them if you‚Äôre up to it, or you could just leave them outside on the curb‚Äîmaybe someone will give them another life, but at the least you‚Äôll have one less negative thing to dwell on.

I‚Äôm really sorry to hear you‚Äôre struggling and I hope it gets better! Make sure you cut yourself some slack‚Äîwhatever you decide to do, your mental health is more important than the fate of your houseplants.

If I were you I would continue to not engage with her at all‚Äîyou won‚Äôt change her mind and a confrontation would be hard on everyone involved, your boyfriend included. But it‚Äôs also not on you to go out of your way to avoid her, and if you‚Äôre with her son long term, that probably wouldn‚Äôt be possible. So just be bland and polite when you have to see her, and be prepared to discreetly eject from the situation if she starts up the hateful ranting. Lastly, it‚Äôs probably a good idea to limit what she can see on your Facebook.
Wow, that monstera is amazing!! My kind of crazy.
I‚Äôve only had it about a week, but the yellower (it‚Äôs really more like a yellow-green) leaves have been sticking around so far! Sorry I can‚Äôt be more help.
Beautiful! I did my most recent prop in a mason jar and the leaves are all at weird angles. Time to be more liberal with soy sauce so I can copy you!

I have a fairly new one in a six inch pot which seems pretty healthy, and many of the vines are pink. My philo has more yellow and is a lighter green than many I‚Äôve seen‚Äîmaybe it has to do with pigmentation?

For the national office, I‚Äôve been told it‚Äôs in the 60-75K range, but don‚Äôt quote me on that, may be a little higher. Fellowships will pay a bit less and regional office salaries will likely be tied to cost of living and that chapter‚Äôs resources. Overall, it‚Äôs at the high end of entry-level nonprofit range.
Check out Teladoc. I‚Äôve only ever used it for UTIs but I know their services are much broader than that.

Warm sun on my face, the smell of spring, a really good hug. The soft motor noise my cat makes when he purrs. And the fact that it‚Äôs always a little bit better in the morning. Late night depressive thoughts are their own brand of awful, but they always pass.
They stole your dad vibe? Geez, I'm sorry. I live near Northgate/980 overpass where a lot of abandoned-looking cars seem to end up--I'll keep an eye out.

I‚Äôm well on my way. Therapy has helped a LOT. It happens in baby steps. You should be proud of yourself for working on healing!

Yes, totally. I‚Äôve been working on dismantling it bit by bit, or at least trying to communicate what I need or what I‚Äôm feeling to people who love me. But I have such a hard time communicating, and even sometimes identifying, my feelings in a healthy way.
Thanks!

Respect for authority is not the problem here. It‚Äôs extremely wrong to try to control your kids like this, how will they develop as people or engage with the world when you‚Äôre so restrictive? I feel bad for your kids. And your 19 year old daughter is an adult, you need to let her be one.

Edit: typo

Awesome write up. I feel so sad for Everlyse, and sad that other kids may have suffered at the hands of these people. Even if they weren‚Äôt involved in her appearance (and I think they were, the detail about no one outside the family seeing her for a month is chilling), clearly this family shouldn‚Äôt have had foster children in their home.
Steal some stuff, most likely. Maybe check out some male-only places like locker rooms out of sheer curiosity.
This happened to me when I got a new phone. Go to the title screen ‚Äî> menu ‚Äî> data restore. My game was crashing every time I tried to play and that fixed it.

Echoing other advice to seek therapy. I feel for you so hard‚Äîthis is absolutely brutal. Don‚Äôt be afraid to tell your husband he married YOU and had a kid with YOU. But otherwise, a professional will be able to help much more than anyone here.

Does she know that cigarette smoking is triggering for you? If not, tell her, and without anger. As you say, she‚Äôs an adult and hasn‚Äôt done anything wrong, but it‚Äôs also reasonable to ask her to consider your feelings. You might ask her not to tell you if she smokes, to never smoke around you, etc. Since she‚Äôs not a regular smoker, this shouldn‚Äôt be a problem. She may also decide not to smoke cigarettes at all after you explain how you feel.

Medium impact I think! When someone takes care in how they present themselves and wears clothes that suit them, they project self-knowledge and confidence, and I really like those qualities. I also think clothes make a huge impact on overall appearance and attractiveness,
This made me smile. I‚Äôm happy I could help give you that!

I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre dealing with such awful insomnia! I take meds for insomnia now without any issues but I struggled with it for decades. Have you heard of ASMR? I find watching ASMR videos before bed can really help quiet my brain and make me sleepy. I live in a legal weed state and absolutely nothing beats a THC edible after dinner, but I know views on cannabis and legality vary a ton, so that‚Äôs definitely not a method for everyone.

Yep. It makes me so sad to see how easy things seem for other people, when debilitating fear and anxiety make everyday life so exhausting for me. Like right now I‚Äôm curled up on my couch at 3pm in a bathrobe, while there are countless successful, happy people with vibrant social lives being out in the world right this second without that fear and anxiety. I can‚Äôt shake the belief that I could never attain something like that, and it feels awful.

Wow that is so disgusting. I can‚Äôt believe he won‚Äôt stop after you‚Äôve spoken to him about this! How much of a sacrifice is it to use a damn tissue? The sex thing is a separate, and also distressing issue. Honestly I think you should reevaluate the relationship and/or cohabitation.
Invite him to your campsite, then he‚Äôll ask you to craft it and it will get added to your catalogue.

It really depends on the person, but I think a first step is to communicate how you feel. Acknowledge that they aren‚Äôt trying to hurt or scare you (unless they are, in which case I don‚Äôt advise opening up to them), but that their raising their voice makes you feel panicked and afraid. Ask them candidly to try to moderate their voice when they‚Äôre upset, and follow up if they fail to do it. 

Raised voices is a trigger for me too. I‚Äôm only now getting comfortable asking people to please lower their voices. But family can be really hard‚ÄîI could still never say something like the above to my mom, the original offender. I‚Äôm almost 30 and I still jump when I hear her scream at her dog :(

I‚Äôm with you! I‚Äôm always feeling like I wish I were more social but in the moment the thought of being polite and saying the right things always feels like so much more than I can handle. I‚Äôve even found myself avoiding eye contact with people whom I was once friendly with when I see them at work or school.
I think you should punish her if she borrows your stuff without your permission again, and probably that you shouldn‚Äôt allow her to borrow your things, period.

Adult acne sucks but what your husband has said sucks more. I‚Äôm sorry you have to deal with this, I hope you let him know that he‚Äôs being unkind and making something unpleasant worse rather than supporting you as he should. Marriage is forever, y‚Äôall are going to have wrinkles someday, and if he loves you he should at the very least shut up about your acne.

It sounds like, for whatever reason, your fianc√© didn‚Äôt experience this joke as good humored and sincere. Have you asked him what bothered him specifically? Maybe he‚Äôs humorless, or maybe he misunderstood you or is a little sensitive about something related to the joke. Only thing you can do is communicate

Yep, and a lot of what you said really resonated with me. I find friendships with other women to be difficult because the expectation of pleasantries, compliments, talking about feelings, etc. makes me feel so uncomfortable, like a role I‚Äôm not talented or confident enough to play. Being jokey and self-deprecating with male friends is so much less vulnerable.

With compliments specifically, the way I see it, when your upbringing teaches you that you aren‚Äôt worthy or valuable, accepting a compliment feels wrong, maybe even like lying. I have to fight off the urge to say ‚Äúno I‚Äôm not‚Äù or interpret it as insincere when I receive a compliment. I try to just say thank you and move past it, discomfort and all, because I know the complimenter meant well and I don‚Äôt want to alienate them. But it‚Äôs admittedly an imperfect solution.
You clearly know the answer. Would you ever call someone you love ‚Äúa dumb cunt‚Äù? That‚Äôs incredibly hurtful and degrading. I hope you move on from this guy, you deserve better!
My sister respecting my boundaries. I have some baggage man.
Good list!

Chronic depression here. I try to get a good night‚Äôs sleep and I tell myself I‚Äôm going to put one foot in front of the other. Sometimes all I can do is ride it out and try not to beat myself up too much in the process.

You know what the right thing to do is if you don‚Äôt see the situation ever improving‚Äîbreak off the engagement. 

I can relate a lot‚Äîmy partner and I struggle to keep our living space clean, and there‚Äôs been a history of tension between us over how we share that burden. And like you, I end up shouldering the bulk of the cleaning because I care more or I cave first. But I‚Äôm ultimately okay with it because he makes up for it in other ways, like paying for more than his share of groceries and taking the lead on making dinner. I love him, I‚Äôm grateful that he feeds me, and I can live with him being more of a slob than me. Hiring a cleaning service would be a good fix if your problem was the mess, but it‚Äôs not, the problem is him not helping you when you tell him you NEED him to. That‚Äôs selfish and unfair to you. 

FWIW, I think individual therapy might be a help to you as you navigate this. It‚Äôs sucks your couples‚Äô counselor was so dismissive, but I‚Äôll bet there‚Äôs a professional out there who could help make this all a little easier on you.

It‚Äôs happened to me but I‚Äôm very non-confrontational. I just limited contact on my end and avoided being alone with them. It sucks when the person is otherwise a good friend but I guess this speaks to character...
I‚Äôm really glad to hear that! The impulse is self-protective, but taking a risk and opening yourself up to someone who cares about you can be so rewarding.

I‚Äôve worked on this so much in therapy and I still really struggle with it. It‚Äôs made me cut myself off from the outside world in different ways throughout my life and it‚Äôs just heartbreaking. Any behavior that doesn‚Äôt make me seem unobjectionable can fill me with shame, I‚Äôm always imagining people‚Äôs bad reactions to things no one reasonable would react badly to. All of that mental energy can fog up the meaningful connection you make with someone you trust when you‚Äôre vulnerable. We do it to protect ourselves, but in a lot of ways it keeps us isolated.

The way I see it, trauma isn‚Äôt going anywhere. Either I confront it or it stays invisible but keeps its hold on me. But healing is above all about taking care of yourself‚Äîif dredging up the past feels beyond your bandwidth, then you could just let it be for now.

FWIW I strongly agree. I don‚Äôt get so angry I‚Äôm almost shaking unless the thing cuts deep because of my history, fears, etc. Not to knock OP or discount her feelings at all, there is just usually a reason for such a strong reaction to something involving only third parties, even when it‚Äôs family.
Emeryville Home Depot FTW
Oof, the Sephoras all over the place and culture of high end consumerism don‚Äôt make things any easier!
Similar, but when I lived in New York I spent a good chunk of my salary on fancy lipstick. One day after getting therapy I woke up with 50 barely-used lipsticks and this same revelation.

I recently moved here from New York and it was a huge problem there. Never look at your phone with headphones in while you're in public, especially at night. Another common scam is asking someone what time it is, and then snatching the phone while you look at it to check. Unfortunately I've found that Find My iPhone is pretty useless against smartphone thieves in recent years--they turn them off right away once they have them. In fact seeing that your phone is off when you've misplaced it is a strong indication you'll never get it back.
Same. Though there's a woman at 25th and Telegraph who calls me a bitch every time I walk past her without giving her money.
YUP. I recently turned onto 24th from MLK and the block before Northgate was a crack deal parking lot

I grew up with a single mom and my only sister is four years younger than me. Honestly being her big sister has made me a better person‚ÄîI‚Äôm a lot more responsible, more conscientious and empathetic because I had to be nice to her, comfort her, take care of her, even when she annoyed me or I was teenaged and moody. A close second is always getting to be the boss.

She probably didn‚Äôt want to discuss anything immigration or citizenship-related with you after how you‚Äôve behaved. You‚Äôre cagey about what your parents (and you, to some extent) believe, so I‚Äôm not sure how offensive this all is to her, but I‚Äôm surprised she‚Äôs being ‚Äúneutral‚Äù because this sounds like it‚Äôs been absolutely horrible for her. Like if I‚Äôm reading this correctly, your parents acted like immigrants were less-than in some way and you didn‚Äôt stand up for her. Then you refused to affirm that you supported her and other immigrants when she asked you to. I think you need to start whatever conversation you have about this with an apology.

What you‚Äôre going through is so hard‚Äîabove all else please try to be kind to yourself. You‚Äôre dealing with a disease that causes intense suffering and distorts your perspective on that suffering and basically everything else. It‚Äôs a gargantuan struggle. But as I‚Äôm sure you know intellectually (knowing vs believing can be hard), it will get better. 

I have chronic depression. In my experience, in the moment when you‚Äôre feeling so low, usually the best thing you can do is make it to the next day and try to do one tiny thing that‚Äôs good for yourself. Listen to a playlist you used to love, take a bath (less energy-intensive than a shower), go for a walk around the block, write for a bit in your journal and reflect on how you‚Äôre feeling. On days that you feel better, try to do a little more‚Äîwash the dishes, call a friend, fix a simple meal. Don‚Äôt feel bad about whatever your capacity is day to day and don‚Äôt feel like you need to apologize to anyone for it. It‚Äôs absolutely brutal, but the only way out is through. 

For what it‚Äôs worth, the only thing that has actually worked for me in managing, rather than just surviving, my depression is investing in self-care and the preventative stuff. I‚Äôm medicated and normally see a therapist, and I know eating and sleeping enough can go a long way when things start to get hard. Personally, forcing myself to go through the motions helps a lot on a day to day basis, but it can also be really taxing. 

I really hope things get better for you soon. Don‚Äôt be afraid to reach out to people in your life for support if you need it.
I‚Äôm really sorry to hear that. Whatever you decide, it‚Äôs between the both of you and not up to your parents.

Wow, what a nasty post-nuptial surprise! I wouldn‚Äôt worry about it too much once the initial shock wears off‚Äîyou are pretty distant genetically and it‚Äôs not like you had a pre-romance family relationship. Y‚Äôall might consider getting some counseling to process this though.

It‚Äôs not in poor taste but I think a letter/written narrative could achieve the same thing and be easier to consume for your prospective therapists. Personally I‚Äôve perfected a 5-minute readers digest version of my trauma and depression story because I see psychiatrists and therapists separately (too expensive to do them together) and I‚Äôve switched my health insurance a bunch. I can definitely relate to not wanting to talk through the whole thing over and over.
This was hilarious, I‚Äôm glad your date was chill about it and that you didn‚Äôt have to reenact that scene from Pulp Fiction. Very curious about the effects of this weed lube...
The spirit is willing but the flesh is in anaphylactic shock!

Great write up!! This is absolutely chilling. It sounds on the one hand like a case of mistaken identity in a planned hit (like he got the wrong Marilyn the first time) but with the victims being unassuming older women who led quiet lives and the sexual assault detail... It‚Äôs bizarre and terrifying. 

I grew up in the area, was there at the time, and this is actually the first I‚Äôve heard of it.

I‚Äôm happy for you healing from this AWFUL treatment by your mom! It‚Äôs important to remember that you can assert a boundary and expect your loved one to respect it. We get to push away when we feel scared or triggered.
Break up with her. This won‚Äôt be the last racist comment she makes and this is a big misalignment in values. Best of luck finding a non-horrible human to date instead!

There‚Äôs actually an exception in the FHA for roommates and people who share close quarters (the idea being that women may sensibly want to share a bathroom only with other women, etc.), but that doesn‚Äôt make OP‚Äôs girlfriend‚Äôs position any less objectionable,

Too funny! At least you didn‚Äôt send it around your professional or social circles.
That‚Äôs horrible, congrats on getting away and going NC. The gall of nparents to guilt you for not being grateful enough for their terrible parenting never ceases to make my blood boil.
Wow what a coincidence! I‚Äôm sorry to hear you have to deal with it too. I have a lot of guilt about getting to be the ‚Äúwell daughter‚Äù but that‚Äôs it‚Äôs own can of worms. We DO got this!
Haha I‚Äôm with you! I‚Äôll eat gummy vitamins every morning and it will be an easy win.
I am so hung up on that detail. I love weed and I love my fat cat and I couldn‚Äôt spend that much on those things if I tried!

I completely understand that fear, but I promise you it isn‚Äôt true. Growing up with narcs can make you feel broken and unworthy, but you aren‚Äôt. If it‚Äôs any help, when I‚Äôm overwhelmed by feelings that I‚Äôm broken, unloveable, etc., I try to focus on healing (writing, reading old journals, sitting quietly with tea and thoughts about my childhood) because it redirects the ruminations a bit, and is also what can help ease those feelings in the long run.
Congratulations! I‚Äôve had my copper IUD just about 10 years. I love it and am very sad I have to get it taken out soon.

I agree that grey rocking can be pretty effective in these situations. Once you get roped in, you lose a lot of the control and it‚Äôs easy to recreate childhood dynamics. Creating emotional and physical distance is all you can do.
Your boyfriend is gaslighting you and being emotionally abusive. You should absolutely leave him. You deserve to feel safe!

My mom is very codependent with my sister and I and it makes me so, so upset. It was really bad when I was a kid because she would talk to me like an adult/co-parent and it was too much for me to handle. Now, she‚Äôs intrusive, judgmental, makes us responsible for meeting her needs, is critical of our relationships with others to keep us closer to her, and with my sister she‚Äôs overly involved in medical matters and behaves as if my 25 year old sister still needs her care like a child would. 

Not sure if this helps but I‚Äôve dealt with it by moving across the country and limiting my contact with her. The dynamic with my sister and my mom ignoring my boundaries are incredibly distressing, so I try to limit our interactions to short weekly phone calls and 2-3 visits per year of no more than a few days. Tbh I would like to limit it more lol.

Yeah :( I just found out I‚Äôm vitamin D deficient and it‚Äôs hard not to hope it‚Äôs the cause of everything I feel is ‚Äúwrong‚Äù with me and that everything will turn around in a few months if I just take vitamins. Or I‚Äôll wonder if a new diagnosis for my mental illness or a new medication could fix all my problems and make me ‚Äúlike other people.‚Äù

It makes me so sad because intellectually I know I‚Äôm pretty great and not broken, but it‚Äôs a false set of beliefs I‚Äôve held for such a long time that it‚Äôs really hard to shake.

I was in a situation like this many years ago and it sucked.  Ended up in him ‚Äúbreaking things (aka periodic very drunk hookups) off‚Äù and me sobbing at my own party. 

I hope this doesn‚Äôt sound harsh, but I think if this guy we‚Äôre genuinely interested in being with you as more than a drunk make out buddy, you would know it already. Let him go and work on finding someone who will prioritize you and make you feel special whether he‚Äôs drunk or sober. You deserve it!
Your morning ritual sounds so sweet!!

That‚Äôs interesting! My partner and I have lived together for the past seven years and going to bed together is a big part of our domestic rituals. Admittedly we have always lived in expensive cities without a lot of extra money (thanks, media industry), so we‚Äôve always shared a one bedroom/one bath apartment. I would like my own shower and maybe a big closet/dressing room, but waking up together is one of my favorite parts of the day. And we only have one cat, so someone (him) would be cat-less and lonely if we slept separately.
Trust is a choice. Your gf has given you no indication she‚Äôs cheated. If you can‚Äôt choose to trust her, it‚Äôs going to get in the way of the relationship progressing.
